website_summaries.verdict: A slow feeder and an interactive cat toy in one, this option puts a stop to scarfing  while making mealtime more interesting at the same time.
pros: Wide, lidded top compartment is easy to fill
Automatically dispenses food to tunnels along the sides for a stimulating mealtime challenge
Wide base helps keep "caught" food off the floor
Adjustable output gives owners full control of portion sizes
cons: Screwing the feeder lid on and off can be fiddly

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy for Food Motivated Cats
customer_reviews.text: My cat used to be feral so he is super food motivated, so this toy has been a wonderful enrichment tool for him. It will keep him busy for anywhere from 15-45 minutes depending on how difficult I make it for him. The most difficult part for him are the little goldfish bowls, so I only do those if I want him to be busy for longer periods of time as he does get kind of frustrated if I do it every single time. Here is a video of one of the first times he ever got to use his new toy! Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Loni E

customer_reviews.title: At least they are really cute...
customer_reviews.text: Well, I thought my cats were pretty smart. They use their fountain. They take my socks out of the drawer and hide them around the house. They ask for treats and protect us from suspicious shadows and rogue breezes. This toy is way above their pretty little heads, though. I tried modeling, hand over paw assistance and explaining the process carefully in two languages (English and Cat) to no avail. I will likely relocate the toy closer to the sock drawer. Maybe some magic will occur.
customer_reviews.author: NOLA Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Can't thank this product enough! My kitten was gulping ...
customer_reviews.text: Can't thank this product enough! My kitten was gulping down her food and throwing up after every meal...even after just small tablespoons at a time. Nothing was helping till this feeder! No more vomiting since!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M.

customer_reviews.title: Mad Scientist - engaging and challenging - different than the "digging" type puzzles that Trixie offers.
customer_reviews.text: Great toy and different type of challenge. I've got three other trixie cat food puzzles in addition to this one I just received. The "hunting" on the ground ones are hugely popular but this introduces a new challenge with having to spin the tubes. One of my cats is very motivated and likes challenges. It took him 5 minutes and under to pick up on it. Video attached. Start with the single tube and slowly work with them. You may want to use their own foot to pull down the foot as an instruction guide.
customer_reviews.author: Tulip_Mesa

customer_reviews.title: My cat loves this puzzle
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this. Just challenging enough for very smart cat. Suggest you use a marker to number the bottom of modules when you take them off to wash them. They must be put back in a particular order. I made videos of him solving different modules. Amazing to watch his puzzle-solving.
customer_reviews.author: Christmas-baby

customer_reviews.title: Answer to questions and kudos
customer_reviews.text: This is in answer to someone who asked "Does the cat turn the insides?...... You put the food in the top, it dispenses to the 6 tunnels and the cat moves around the feeder finding food in the tunnels and pulling it out with its paws. It definitely slows the eating down and I find my cat chews more thoroughly. She's had no incidences of vomiting since we have gotten this product. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: Very popular with my cats
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this toy and will spend time pulling regular dry food and treats our of this, while a full bowl of the same dry food sits ignored beside it. Only one of my three cats is food motivated, but they all enjoy this toy. The only problem is finding the ping pong balls they've knocked all over the house.
customer_reviews.author: Kaillayna

customer_reviews.title: adapts well to automatic feeders
customer_reviews.text: there are many good puzzle/maze bowls on amazon in the $10-$30 price range. i picked this one as it seemed to adapt well cap off to my recentpurchase - see customer photo I posted here. i solved the sliding around problem with duct tape, and the 2" tunnels are large and rugged enough for my 7-8 pound cats. for me it would have been better if Trixie designers had made the center screw favor half the tunnels over the other, instead of trying to ration them all out equally. since my Feedster already does the rationing, I do not use this feature on my Trixie.
customer_reviews.author: Joey NYC

customer_reviews.title: Mensa Cats
customer_reviews.text: I love all of the trixie models, this one was the most challenging at first. Once the cats got the hang of it it became way too easy... I think the product would be improved if there was a way to alter the mechanisms so the challenges would continue. Maybe my cats are geniuses. In that case, I should be scared.
customer_reviews.author: M. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Cats with large paws
customer_reviews.text: As with the other items I ordered, this is probably suited for a young cat. The over all space between the different areas are much to small. My cats have large paws and had a difficult time getting the treats out from each section.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: One flaw, danger to eyes
customer_reviews.text: Only problem is that our cat tried to get the treat from what is designated as Area/Game 2 (upright pegs next to small bowls) with his tongue, which endangered his eyes. If not for that, a great diversion, but I have to return because of this. I need his eyes to be safe, of course.
customer_reviews.author: BMac

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Puzzle Feeder
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful puzzle feeder that enables cats to forage for food/treats. It has multiple different puzzles that the cat has to figure out. Of course, it works best with cats who are very food motivated or if you can find an extra special treat that can motivate them. My Burmese cat is very smart and food motivated and he still has not figured out one of the puzzles. What I really like about this particular puzzle feeder is that it can be easily taken apart and either hand washed or washed in the dishwasher. This was a very important feature because I like to use white albacore tuna in it as a special treat for the cats.
customer_reviews.author: 2burmese

customer_reviews.title: FALLS APART
customer_reviews.text: They sent me a puzzle with broken pieces and then refused to replace the broken pieces. I would have had to pay to send the whole thing back which would have cost me more than the product originally. So, tossed it all in the garbage because I was afraid the rest of it would break off and cause harm to my kitties. VERY LOW QUALITY PRODUCTS from Trixie.
customer_reviews.author: JoDell S.

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for helping with weight loss!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help one of my cats to lose weight. She loves to eat and was really overweight. With this toy, I am able to put her food in among the ping pong balls and in the top tray and it takes her quite some time to get to it all. I do this several times a day and last thing at night. She shares an area with her sister who does not overeat. She has plenty of time to finish her food before Naomi so no food stealing occurs! The vet today was very happy to see that her weight has come down to 12 pounds!
customer_reviews.author: AnneV

customer_reviews.title: Poor design... unintentionally frustrating for me and my cat!
customer_reviews.text: For starters, the toy looks much smaller than in the video. But the most disappointing aspect of this toy's design is that the cat treats get caught in the track of the sliding square cups. My cat manages to pull the treat from the cup, but if it falls down outside the cup and she tries to retrieve it, it slides into the track where my cat cannot get to it. (This occurs almost every time.) The treats are about the size of a dime, and significantly thick, so this shouldn't happen. I end up turning the toy upside down and shaking it to get the remaining treats--- a frustration to me and my cat :(
customer_reviews.author: BHNY

customer_reviews.title: Spin!
customer_reviews.text: My 2-year-old cat loves this. It took a couple tries to figure it out. She is very food motivated and loves treat puzzles. This one makes her work for her treats. I like that it comes with different lids to increase the difficulty level.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Cooper

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay.
customer_reviews.text: My cat doesn’t really care for it. He will do it if he sees treats in it but it takes a lot for my to call him over and over to show him exactly where and let me tell you I have a smart cat. He plays fetch, opens doors, plays hide and seek, hides toys for me to look for and remembers exactly where he puts them.. So for him not to be interested was strange. Also.. he will be 2 in a few months
customer_reviews.author: mariah russell

customer_reviews.title: Stumped her for a little while...
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth puzzle we've gotten for our 2yr old cat...she's mastered them all (we have to put them away when empty or she sits by them and howls)...we put them out in rotation and she investigates a bit...then the light dawns and the treats are cleared in under two minutes...but at least they slow her down a bit...and it is our treat to watch... The other cat (3yr old male) has absolutely no interest in any of the puzzles... So can not say if your's will...but for Chloe....great fun.
customer_reviews.author: Don Lj Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, flimsy and MISSING PARTS!
customer_reviews.text: Our vet got the dog version for her cat and recommended we try it for our Siamese, Maleficent. 1) There were NO instructions. Not even a pictorial. And as far as we can gather, it was missing the screws and nuts for the bar. Were we sold a return or defected item? 2) it was light and flimsy. Mal had it tipped on its side in about 10 seconds and then it didn't work. 3) the tubes never did spin right. They got stuck to each other and that's likely why Mal was able to knock it over. Returning. Thank goodness we got it on Prime.
customer_reviews.author: kittenspawn

customer_reviews.title: Maybe my cat, Paul, is a little too smart.
customer_reviews.text: I placed it on the floor and Paul stared at it, so I filled it with treats in effort to engage him. He wanted nothing to do with learning how to work it and seemed miffed that he couldn't readily access the treats. I went to bed. I could hear him messing with it during the night, and when I got up in the morning, the drawers had been flung across the room, he had totally trashed it! He sits in front of it and 'hints' that it needs refilling almost constantly. I move the sections around in effort to challenge him, but he figures it out within minutes, every time!
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Phillips

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS IF YOU HAVE A CAT
customer_reviews.text: I got this in the mail not even ten minutes ago and my cat and I both love it! It was amazing to watch her figure out all the different activitys. She is declawed and is able to get treats from all the different ones, I was worried she would not be able to but she is. I feel like I just opened up another part of her brain. This product may seem pricey but it is worth it. The product itself it made with a very durable plastic that could easily withstand cat bites. I reccomend this for any cat owner. UPDATE: I still use this every day. Cat never gets bored
customer_reviews.author: bridget rose

customer_reviews.title: I wish they had one for humans.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe this works as well as it does. My extremely stubborn cat used to scarf her food down and then barf it up all over my beautiful IKEA rug. When I bought this, I wasn’t sure it would work. I figured my cat would starve herself in protest, but she figured out how to use the bowl within minutes. She does still yell at me about having to work for her food...but I haven’t had to clean up barf off my rug so I call that a win!
customer_reviews.author: G. Reagan

customer_reviews.title: Love this one!
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised at how much my cats enjoy this simple feeder. I have one overweight declawed 6 year old female, and one 2 year old large male with large paws with claws. They both reach in there and get their kibble. One piece at a time. They eat slower now instead of inhaling their food. And I think they are less bored. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca J. DeTuncq

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing product
customer_reviews.text: This product was a real disappointment for my very playful cat. Of the varied 'obstacles' he could only play two of four. The 'fish bowls' too round a small opening w lip. He has never been able to get out one treat! The obstacle with small squares are only good I think for kittens with small paws ... he was unable to dig treats out. He's not big, only 9lbs and very playful. Poor guy got sooo frustrated that he decided to totally give up on the whole toy board. A waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Helps keep cats from overeating
customer_reviews.text: This feeder has helped my 5 cats from overeating and constantly puking up un-digested food immediately after wolfing it down. They have to work a little for the food and seem slightly disgruntled with me, but it took them no time at all to figure it out and I hear the scraping food out of the little bowls at night time. the little squares seem to be their favorite place to take the food from. This is also nice and sturdy and they haven't tipped it over (they're an ambitious crew) yet and seems easy to clean. Its definitely served its purposed. It's probably paid for itself in wasted food that didn't get puked up.
customer_reviews.author: Terry J. Maimone

customer_reviews.title: Big hit with the cats!
customer_reviews.text: My cats LOVE this activity center. They usually only eat canned food, so dry food is a big treat for them and they're willing to work hard to get it. They're both 12 years old, indoor-only, and big fans of sleeping. I love that this gets them up and moving and excited about earning their "reward". Unfortunately neither of them have been able to figure out how to get food out of the four bubbles, but maybe they will eventually. Overall I'm thrilled with this purchase - nothing makes me happier than having happy cats. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jenn M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 cats that can eat too quickly then vomit their food. I got 2 different products that slow their eating. I prefer this product over the one that has the "spikes" sticking up. My cats prefer this one too and I think it's because it doesn't bother their whiskers when they try to eat. I didn't have to show them how to get the food they knew how to get the food. They also can't tip it over or take off the lid. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Coffey

customer_reviews.title: Cute for Kitties
customer_reviews.text: It didn't take my cat long to learn how to use it. I was going to use it to get her to work for her kibble, but after she turns the tube upside down, even with the three hole top (comes with two lids: one with three holes and one with one big hole) kibble would go everywhere! So I'm just going to use it for treats now. She looks so cute playing with it!
customer_reviews.author: Some-Lady-Who-Reviews

customer_reviews.title: My 4 cats LOVE this!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 cats LOVE this!!! They scoop the treats out of the little goldfish bowls directly into their mouths. They have figured out how to maneuver the treats through the little posts and the wavy part. Did I say they LOVE it?! Our oldest is 17 and the youngest is just a year and 1/2 and they both figured it out in a flash. In fact, today Curly Sue (the baby) sat by it tapping it and looking at me. We've gone through more treats since I bought this than we've gone through in the last 2 or 3 years! Get it! Your cats will thank you and give you a lot of laughs.
customer_reviews.author: DebK

customer_reviews.title: Best feeder ever
customer_reviews.text: My baby kitty (Daisy and Libby) Daisy, has been throwing up since the day I got her (14 month ago). Vet says she is eating too fast the dry food. We have been cleaning up puke piles all over the place for a year. I finally had enough, and said she is going to the doctor! So after the doctor said that, I bought her this thing. Oh my garsh I love it. It looks clean, they like it, I think one night they tried to pop the lid up because they got impatient lol. I’ll duct tape it if I have to... But no more puke piles!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michele Dardis

customer_reviews.title: holes of the round bowls are too small for my ...
customer_reviews.text: holes of the round bowls are too small for my 10 pound cat's paw - impossible for him to grab the treats from them.
customer_reviews.author: katw

customer_reviews.title: Great Brain Puzzle to Instill the Natural Foraging Instinct!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so impressed by this sturdy, effective product that engages my teenage kitty! He’s become bored and started biting me, trying to communicate with me. I bought him several brain puzzles; I read the directions on how to train your cat; he learned the first, easiest two rather quickly! Lifting the lid and pulling the rope to open the drawer. I decided to initially up-the-value of the treat with bits of of premium hot dog, but he scoffed that. He went for regular treats! I ended up teaching him three of the four puzzles in one evening! He loves it! It has given us more opportunities for bonding!
customer_reviews.author: Arizonadesertgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great interactive food toy
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that my three-legged cat wouldn't be able to use this but I'm glad I was wrong. My girl eats too much too fast. This helped slow her down and she is very pleased with herself for figuring each part out. The only one she isn't able to use is the plastic bowl section because it does require a bit more balance and coordination, which is more difficult when one only has one front limb. It's a bit difficult to clean but I can't think of any improvements because the pegs are permanently attached to the structure of the tray. Overall, I'm very happy with it and it makes getting treats more interactive and fun for my cat.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dickey

customer_reviews.title: Try to find the ORIGINAL version of this treat & kibble dispenser.
customer_reviews.text: The original white & blue spinner was well-made, though the base did need to be fastened down to prevent tipping. The bottles spun freely and the plastic was smooth, and clean. I have returned this new grey & red version: The grey frame had sharp edges along two seams, black streaks (looked like grease but didn’t wipe off), and the bottles did not spin freely. Loosening the tensioner screw made no difference because excess plastic made the bottles sit too closely together within the framework. VERY DISAPPOINTING!
customer_reviews.author: ohcat9

customer_reviews.title: Cat is not smart enough to avoid poking himself in eye with product.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It is exactly what it seems to be. Cons: Cat is not smart enough to avoid poking himself in eye with product. (Seriously.) But to give you all useful information, this board is a great size for cats maybe up to 11-12 pounds, or for cats with small paws. We have a large tom that wasn’t neutered before we got him, and he has a lot of difficulty getting his paws into the peg board. The bowls are so small that even our smaller cat with dainty paws can barely reach into them. (The cats work together to twist and rip the bowls out of the board instead.)
customer_reviews.author: K. Hanley

customer_reviews.title: My cat now owns the best toy ever.
customer_reviews.text: This came quick enough considering everything going on. The food puzzle/busy toy was packed well & was snug in the box. The item is clean looking and surprisingly sturdy. Couldn't wait to try it out. Kibble in a few of the cups, a few little smears of wet food in various places and let the cats have at it. They were occupied by the newest thing & were kept engaged until the snacks were finished. I enjoyed their attentiveness whilst showing them each hiding place and was thoroughly amused at them trying to snatch all the goodies. Very satisfied. Thx.
customer_reviews.author: linda letiziasimons

customer_reviews.title: I guess my cats are too lazy for this
customer_reviews.text: I tried easing them into it, as the instructions suggest—putting some treats in the easiest puzzle first, and sitting with the cats and showing them how to do it. One of them was interested, but not interested enough to actually retrieve any food that wasn't immediately reachable. And it made no difference how hungry they were; they would apparently rather starve than struggle.
customer_reviews.author: Book Geek

customer_reviews.title: Great for curious, intelligent cats
customer_reviews.text: One of our two cats absolutely loves this toy. He is very intelligent and has a natural tendency to figure stuff out (our other cat can't be bothered). We found that it provided the best challenge when there are only two test tubes instead of three. Three tubes didn't spin as easy and sometimes they would get stuck upside down and all of the treats would fall out. With just two, he can really bat at it and spin it around and he has to work a bit harder to get a treat to drop (we also have the toughest lids on). We've been very pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: K.H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy well-made product. I unfortunately had to return it because my cats are too stupid. With lots of encouragement after several weeks they would take a treat from the side of the tray, but could not figure out to use their paws if the treat was not immediately accessible. (These cats will look at you from a cracked doorway and cry because they don’t realize they can just push the door open). But honestly it seems like a really great product and I give it high marks. It just was not for us.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great product from a great seller
customer_reviews.text: First on the product: Arrived in great time and both my cats have successfully opened each compartment after a bit of pawing at it. If anything, it is more fun for me to watch their minds at work! I am super happy with my purchase! Second thing I'd like to point out is how fantastic the seller is. When my package first arrived, there had a need for me to contact the seller. A message and a picture sent, I received a response less than 24 hours later. Through the rest of the process, the seller kept me updated and the situation was resolved. I highly recommend not only this product, but purchasing from this seller as well!
customer_reviews.author: loverofbooks

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product. I almost didn't get this one because I thought it was too simple. The hard one doesn't interest her and everything else seems to be too easy. This does slow her down. I put it in there throughout the day. I think I have all the food puzzles. This does come with ping pong balls. I couldn't tell by the description, so ordered those as well. I added a few, but there were plenty with it. They do get pushed out on the floor, so I have back ups if they get lost or I step on some.
customer_reviews.author: M Swisher

customer_reviews.title: My cats love the the Poker Box!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to slow down my cats intake of dry food by making it a little more challenging to get to the food and it works perfectly. My cats like all the compartments except for the rectangular one. It's interesting to watch them go for their favorite box and when that empties out to open another. It's very easy to take apart and clean. You know you've been gone too long during the day when you get home and the tops are open and empty and the drawer is on the floor empty!
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it.
customer_reviews.text: Both of my cats use this. The gluttonous orange one took to it right away after I sat down and showed him how to get some of the food. The other one took a couple of days longer to use it, but now she waits patiently by it to be fed. She prefers eat from the puzzle feeder than her bowl. My only complaint is that I wish there was a rim around it that would catch the food from falling on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: freaknamask

customer_reviews.title: Treats get stuck in the sliding track!
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would be fun for my cat, but it was frustrating because the treats would get stuck in the sliding tracks for the holes and he had trouble getting them out. I was giving him standard treats. Maybe if you had larger treats it wouldn't be an issue. My cat has claws, I think it would be even more challenging for a declawed cat. Interesting idea though, but I have to closely monitor him when he uses it because I was worried it would be frustrating for him when the treats kept getting stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Jackee

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I had to show my cat and entice her digging in the upright tunnels with some treats. I do enjoy that I don't have to put food it in at every meal, as I work odd hours; this gives her a little free reign over her eating schedule. I can leave the storage bit full and it will last her a couple days, but maybe that's because she's too lazy to dig out too much at once (HAHA!). I did accidently tighten the middle part too much and once she had eaten everything in the tunnels, it was too tight to release more food, so that was my fault.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: A Must-Have for Owners of Indoor Cats
customer_reviews.text: Our cats love this. Love it. They haven't gotten the hang of the globes puzzle yet but they love the other four. They have a great time getting their food and we have fun watching them. We put dry food in it and we put hairball medicine/ goo in the little tongue-puzzle on top of the tunnel. We've noticed that they are bored much less frequently (they're not bugging us to play or destroying something in the house). We've gotten them a couple of different activity feeders and we rotate them to keep it interesting. I think every cat owner should get this feeder.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fontes

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price, but buy larger treats!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat loves this puzzle box. We introduced it to him slowly by hiding treats in plain sight at first, and then in gradually harder locations. Worked like a charm. Now he gets excited as soon as he sees us filling it up, and is usually entertained for 30 minutes! The only catch is most treats are actually too small to work well. We were able to find some larger bits of cat jerky that work well, but keep this in mind if you are devoted to a specific kind. Treats like Greenies are too small, and will just get lost in between the layers of plastic, frustrating your cat.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Easy for a smart cat
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly simple toy with several options for a cat to fish treats out of it. That is if your cat is smart and is motivated by food. The toy that I received was pink, not blue like advertised on the images and in the description. Also, the slider is a bit difficult to open and gets slightly stuck. The other parts just need a little nudge. Fairly easy but my cat is either not hungry or just doesn't get it. I guess not the sharpest crayon in the box after all...
customer_reviews.author: L.

customer_reviews.title: Swanky looking feeder for torturing, um er... entertaining, your gluttonous cats
customer_reviews.text: Pros: This is a really nice modern looking feeder with some variety in the puzzles. My cats had outsmarted their simple round puzzle bowl. They understand this one but it slows them down enough to make them work for their food (better for digestion). The Mr Peanut large pet food mat fits well under this feeder, I bought them together and it keeps the feeding area nice and clean. Cons: The clear the fish bowl style feeders don’t interest my cats at all. They won’t put their paws in them. That’s good because I can’t get them off for cleaning. We just ignore them,
customer_reviews.author: tcsfo

customer_reviews.title: Slows cat down, but difficult to clean due to size
customer_reviews.text: It's a good puzzle feeder to have in the rotation to slow down my cat while he's eating. I took away a couple stars, though, because it's rather big and bulky which makes cleaning it very difficult. The globes are removable for easier cleaning, but the rectangular part is too big for the sink and i don't use a dishwasher. I think this would be much better if the different sections could be removed, maybe snap together. That would definitely make it easier to clean, and might enable us to mix up the order of the different sections to make it even more interesting for the cat.
customer_reviews.author: CAM

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my cat after my vet's behavioral specialist recommended I get cat puzzle for when I go to work so she has something to do. This works good, she quickly has figured out the ball and sliding squares but the drawers are more tricky for her so I usually leave them half open. She does try to use her mouth to get the treat though which I don't like. The instructions make it seem like the cat will use its paw which is not the case which my cat. Also the treats we use get sorta stuck in the track. Its good but not great. I'll keep my eyes open for some other ones.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Two Paws Up
customer_reviews.text: My cat had one of these in her room at the shelter to fish out her kibble and give her something to do. She has plenty to now in her forever home but ordered it anyway. So far have just used it for her Greenies and she enjoys fishing them out. This puzzle is very sturdy, heavy enough to stay in place on a wood floor, and has a non-slip bottom. Very easy to clean too. It’s pricy but of excellent quality so worth it to those of us who spoil our cats.
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: I Feel Stupid
customer_reviews.text: So, I researched this feeder - It's supposed to be a great "slow feeder". I tried my best, and could not get this to function as it should. It has a complicated mechanism to adjust the amount of food/treats that can emerge from the openings. I suppose my cats are smarter than all of us, because no matter what I do, my cats eat the contents in less than 10 minutes. It is sitting in the corner of my living room, empty. I will probably donate to someone and wish them the best of luck.
customer_reviews.author: J. Condrey

customer_reviews.title: Best Thing Ever!
customer_reviews.text: My cat is 5 years old and still acts like a curious kitten. I live in a small 1 bedroom apartment so she doesn't have a lot of engaging activity time. I bought the Trixie Activity Center to help engage her and make apartment living a bit more of a treat (pun intended). The video you see is her first attempt at getting the treats from the activity center. She never gave up! The hardest activity was the bowls, and she prevailed after a while. She continues to love this toy and I will never grow bored of watching her work for her food. If only someone would do the same for me!
customer_reviews.author: LostShadow225

customer_reviews.title: My cats like it and it work.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for our cats who eat too fast. Since using this no more surprise upchuck piles and our overweight cat is starting to slim down. I did set the whole feeder in a slightly larger cookie sheet to catch the food that gets swiped off the edge of the feeding tray. The cats know that I won’t refill until all the kibble is gone. It took the a bit to figure out the little fish bowls but they did and they all have their own unique way of getting g the kibble our.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthieo

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for smart cats
customer_reviews.text: The best cat toy is the one that plays to each cat's natural hunting skills and this one works great for mine! I've tried the toys where the cat has to stick their paw in holes to dig out treats and he doesn't get those. However, he loves this one! Each station can be removed from the frame and used individually during training (or washed in the sink if they get dirty - I'm not sure it's dishwasher safe). Then put them all back together and let your furbaby go from one to the next.
customer_reviews.author: R. Browning

customer_reviews.title: but I like that it forces her to take her time while ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm fairly sure my cat hates me because of this, but I like that it forces her to take her time while eating, rather than gouging herself and then complaining of being hungry all day long. She's been struggling to figure out the puzzles, but I found that if I make her use them one at a time over night, each puzzle by itself at first, it forces her to make the effort and she will eventually figure it out. I honestly think she's just lazy. We only have the bowls left to conquer :)
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Oakeson

customer_reviews.title: Not sure who its for...
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats. One fat, older, but confident female and a young spazzy male. The young one immediately took to the pins and track portion of the toy. The female just looked at me like "you have got to be kidding" Eventually, she learned the cups and those remain her favorite, though she is learning the rest of the activity center. I'm not sure if I got this for their amusement or mine. Once they warmed up to it we have had fun together.
customer_reviews.author: james karl  krantz

customer_reviews.title: Nice design , but your cat will be the judge
customer_reviews.text: The activity level is determined by your cat. I have many cats and the cat that I purchased it for took right to it. She actually preferred to work the toy rather than free eat from a bowl. I have some other cats that didn't give it a second look. In my experience generally the lazier the cat the less likely they'll use it. If the cat is inquisitive and still fairly mobile it will be a winner
customer_reviews.author: Realist

customer_reviews.title: My three cats all like it
customer_reviews.text: This board has five different puzzles. My three cats all have their preferences. My tiny footed female loves the waves and the spikes. She can’t do the fish bowls at all. My very large male likes the tube. I think he prefers the Amazing Cat cardboard puzzle instead. My smaller, former feral male will do all the puzzles and clean the whole thing out (he is perpetually starving), but he prefers the fish bowls. It’s solid and doesn’t move around. I’m glad it’s dishwasher safe. I would recommend it for anyone with a treat oriented cat.
customer_reviews.author: A. Larson

customer_reviews.title: Great idea for a cat that needs to lose weight, and to create interest for indoor cats.
customer_reviews.text: My cats are indoor and I like to add interest to their lives. My younger cat likes this a a lot. I move it to different rooms so she doesn't get bored. My older cat used to use it, but her arthritis bothers her too much to deal with it now. Before it got worse, I was glad to see her use it for movement, a little exercise. Oh, and I don't put treats in it. I use the cats' regular dry food. It's healthier for them. I wouldn't want to use tasty treats that aren't good for them, then have them go off their food because the treats taste better.
customer_reviews.author: KL

customer_reviews.title: A learning curve gone well
customer_reviews.text: My cat took a bit to warm up to it and figure it out. She'd noticeably get frustrated after repeatedly dropping a treat back in the tiny bowl, give up, and play with another toy. I'd leave a few of her favorite treats on there, which she slowly started to go for. She's since figured it out. I leave a bit of kibble on there and she'll visit it several times throughout the day.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product and super easy to clean!
customer_reviews.text: Our cat, Sir Cud, loves this interactive treat toy. He had really bad separation anxiety since we adopted him from a neglectful home as a senior cat. We no longer have the signs of a cat hissy-fit when we get home and he’s much more relaxed when we come home from work. Awesome product and super easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Kymberly Playdon

customer_reviews.title: So far kitty is only mildly amused with this. ...
customer_reviews.text: So far kitty is only mildly amused with this. Not sure it was worth the price. She did figure out how to get a few treats out of it, and I put a smaller toy on it to see if she found that interesting -- not much. Update: My 4 year old cat thought this was basically stupid. Then along came new kitten Roger who also gave it a thumbs down. It found its way to a dumpster recently. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: sf36867

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well as a diversion for my kitties I prepare their real food. But there is no way to control the flow so the bowl is useless. Plus it's hard to clean; I can't take it apart without snapping a few of the plastic grips... All that said, it certainly works well in slowing down the pace of their eating. 1/13/2020 update. I'm still using this when feeding my now-two-year-old kitties. They just think it's the way they're supposed to eat. I love the puzzle and many have asked where I got it. The only issue is cleaning it.
customer_reviews.author: BecTec

customer_reviews.title: It does it's job, but it could be better
customer_reviews.text: The place where the top "screws" into place is pretty flimsy. The tracks are very thin and since the plastic bends, it's often frustrating trying to screw the cap on so the cats can't get into the dispenser (If you've filled it with food like I have). As a more nit-picky thing, I wish that the base was wider so that the cats only had to pull the food out of the holes, and not also onto the floor. As it is, my cats took to it pretty quickly and seem to enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: My cats use this exclusively for dry food
customer_reviews.text: This little thing has replaced bowls for my four cat's crunchies. They can eat from it simultaneously and it keeps my piggy cats of the bunch from stuffing themselves and leaving nothing for the others. Now, if they get tired of the flavor in there they will scatter pieces around it on the floor, so if your cats are picky, switch flavors every so often or you might end up with a mess. It reduces the amount my cats free feed, as I used to time out giving them dry food but this makes them work for it and they don't pig out.
customer_reviews.author: e jokell

customer_reviews.title: Whatever it's a great way to stimulate a cat's mind
customer_reviews.text: Don't let my review dissuade you from purchasing this product. Should you buy it YES if..... 1.) Is your Cat curios? 2.) DON'T wait until they're ravenous To try out the Activity Center. 3.)Be willing to spend a mere 5 minutes encouraging you cat to check out the Activity Center. MY loving 12 yr old tortie shell didn't want to play with the Activity Center, Age, she knew I wouldn't torture her with her food, she knows I'm a push over. Whatever it's a great way to stimulate a cat's mind.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Morgan

customer_reviews.title: My cat is smiling with satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: My cat was a bit confused when I moved her food dish away and put this in its place tonight. I sprinkled catnip over it and started by filling the edges and the top of the tunnel with food. After a few minutes she came back and she clearly knew that this was a very special gift just for her. I'm sure it will take her awhile to learn how to use all of the compartments but tonight my cat is smiling with satisfaction.
customer_reviews.author: Michigan Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Pretty cool but a work in progress
customer_reviews.text: I like this because it challenges two of my three cats. One more than the other, and paw size does not seem to be a negative factor as much as I thought it was when we first got this—especially in regard to the cups. However, I don’t like that almost all elements befuddle my third cat. It makes me feel like he is dumber than previously thought, which has been insinuated by others in the past though it is absolutely maybe not true. Via this challenging toy, we are working on these issues and will update the review accordingly if progress is made.
customer_reviews.author: Hagrumph

customer_reviews.title: We lost our baby girl and needed a good way to keep our surviving male cat entertained
customer_reviews.text: We lost our baby girl and needed a good way to keep our surviving male cat entertained. He got the concept early on does really well with it. We put some treats on here if we know we will be gone a bit longer during the day and he will come back to it through out the day. It has helped save some items from being pushed off counters and tables when he's bored.
customer_reviews.author: CrazyKittens

customer_reviews.title: Terrific puzzle for the smart and greedy cat.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly ehat I expected. Simple to put together. I have made some homemade foraging toys for my gang of four, so they at least had an idea where to go with pulling the treats out from the pegs. By next morning the Siamese mix figured it out. And my big greedy tiger knocked it over and then got them out. So on the advice of one of your reviewers, i picked up a small heavy flat weight from Thrift store for a buck and taped it underneath. No more tipping. Here’s Ya Mo at work! She is a food seeking missile and I am hoping to distract her with this so we can eat our people food in peace.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine M Graham

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING, Wish I'd gotten one sooner!
customer_reviews.text: All 4 of my hellraising kitties LOVE this! It keeps them occupied for over an hour at a time! I've started using this instead of a bowl for their kibble and I think it's a really good outlet for all that mischief energy! Wonderful product, I wish I'd gotten one sooner! My cats are very large and even with their huge paws they can still operate this.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Easy Dog Activity
customer_reviews.text: Our trainer recommended this puzzle activity for our Chiweenie “Lulu “. she had it mastered in about a minute when first presented to her. I’ve purchased two other ones that are a tad more difficult. This still keeps her occupied for about 45 seconds which is about how long it takes her to find her treats. It still provides stimulation but I’m on the search to find something more difficult. All in all it’s a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Eyetailyen

customer_reviews.title: ideal way to make my fat cats work for their meals!
customer_reviews.text: i have 5 different food puzzles so that i can feed my 3 very fat adult cats in a variety of ways other than just dumping a few morsels of kibble into a dish. they eat so fast and get such a small amount because they're forever on a diet! now they don't come screaming at me after eating 5 pieces of kibble begging for more--this keeps them busy while they work for their breakfast or dinner. they don't get as bored so easily and seem satisfied after expending both physical & mental energy to satiate their hunger. my 4 kittens enjoy the "games" too!
customer_reviews.author: 2cairnterriers

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Out of all of the toys we bought our cats for Christmas this was the least amusing and we weren't happy with the feeding capabilities of this item. When you put the food in, it sprayed it all over the floor. The cats were not interested in it as it was just like eating from their regular feeder. Did not have to work for it, did not do anything for their brains or motor skills. Not what I expected and now we dont even use it. Wasted all this money. It is pretty though, although not very practical and was very messy.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great for crafty kitties!
customer_reviews.text: Takes some introduction time but she loves it now. My cat is a very crafty kitty and needs all the outlets she can get. This puzzle feeder is awesome. I had to show her how to use the levers a few times so she wasn't just flipping it around the room but she's got the hang of it. Sometimes she'll throw it around for fun. it's also great for getting her to slow eat since there's only small compartments.
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: A blessing
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have had this for my previous cats. It slows them down so they can't jsut gulp the food down. The female cat jsut loves this thing and paws out a hard morsel and chases it around the dinning room frequently before eating it. It really helps with keeping their weight down, but still allows them to snack. Since I have it filled with Hill's Dental formula, she has the best teeth ever.
customer_reviews.author: Pat Savu

customer_reviews.title: Take a paw print before you order
customer_reviews.text: We have a Bengal cross cat who weighs 17 lbs. and has big paws. This activity center cannot be used by this big boy. He literally cannot get his feet into any part of it except wavy area and frankly is not even remotely interested in playing with it. My guy loves anything to do with balls. Even though he loves his kibble, he finds the activity center too frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: Solved our fat kitty problems
customer_reviews.text: This product has been a sanity-saver for us! We had two problems, both due to the greediness of our cat, Lola. Lola gobbled her food and often threw up afterwards, and Lola was quite overweight. Since she is not an only cat, we couldn't easily limit her food intake, but this feeder slowed her down enough to solve both problems. Have had it for several years now with no problems. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy G.

customer_reviews.title: Stimulating, fun, and good quality!
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and well designed. The only module my cats won’t use is the holes at the top of the tunnel for wet food. The board is a little tough to wash since it’s so large, but There aren’t so many books and crannies that it’s impossible to wipe down. This keeps my kitties entertained everyday; reduces competition over food, and prevents vomiting. Highly recommend for food motivated cats. Tricky enough to take some time but perfect for kitties who are only interested in eating.
customer_reviews.author: Shopper

customer_reviews.text: This made a big mess everywhere. To get the kibble out it must be fished out. My cat decides it's easier to just dump it and hockey everything across the kitchen. I was bummed. Think the holes should be smaller? or there needs to be a plastic shield to 1. make it more difficult for the pet in general and 2. to keep more of the food inside the thing.
customer_reviews.author: Brigit & Reid

customer_reviews.title: Very fun, but it can be easily knocked over
customer_reviews.text: Great idea and it works well, except the cats figure out it's easier to just knock the whole thing over and get the treats instead of playing with it for a long time, thereby eliminating the long-term mental exercise element. If you can secure the base with something, it can again be a useful long-term toy. I would tell the maker to make the base heavier and provide some sort of strap or something so it can be secured to something to prevent the cats figuring out the knock-over shortcut. Overall, a good product if you take some extra precautions.
customer_reviews.author: Robin L.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product with a couple design flaws
customer_reviews.text: I think this is probably the most complicated puzzle toy I've seen for cats. That said, it didn't take long for my cat to figure out how to get all the treats. He's super food motivated which helped a lot. However these days he maybe only gets a couple treats and just looks up at me wanting me to do it for him. Apparently he's also lazy. One flaw in the design is that these treats often get caught in the tracks preventing the sliders from moving. Another problem is that the loose balls that the cat must remove before moving the sliders can easily be lost.
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Try this if your cat is not interested
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the Trixie 5-in-1 Activity Center. At first, like many others, my cat looked at me like I was crazy when I presented him with this toy. No way he wanted to work for his food. I put his dry kibble in the toy, took away all his other food and waited for him to get hungry enough to figure it out. Tough love, right? The same day he was eating from the toy and seems to prefer the fish bowl and pokey things. It took him a while to be more proficient at it but today, he jumps up on the table and excitedly eats from this thing!
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Really impressive toy!
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts on getting this. Initially, our cat seemed wary of it. We showed her how to move treats around with our finger and she picked up on it very fast. Spending time with her helped as well, we'd give encouragement and that made a lot of difference. She's not figured out the bowls yet. But she's become more active overall, wanting to pounce and play more too! I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent game for cats
customer_reviews.text: One of our two cats was immediately intrigued by the Fun Board and quickly started retrieving food. The second cat took one more day to get accustomed to it. Now one or both cats will hunt for kibbles even when food is in their regular bowls. Both cats can easily use the Fun Board at the same time. The only significant design flaw is that kibbles will fall between or underneath the bowls where the cats cannot reach them.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Hard heavy plastic will last a loooong time.
customer_reviews.text: Kitten entertained us the first night this arrived. Since then we've not been good about offering his food with this...to make the hunt for food more entertaining/natural for the growing kitten. Need to buy smellier dry food and use that and treats from our cooked meats. Perhaps some cooked vegetables. He likes cut up homemade pancakes, too. Bats and flings it around like prey. Doesn't slide on carpet....a toe stubber if you put it where you'll be walking.
customer_reviews.author: AnnB

customer_reviews.title: Sharp edges!
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent enrichment for a smart cat but the edges need to be sanded down. Some of the edges are like a serrated knife. You can only imagine my concern when I found dried blood. I had to make modifications to protect my cat. I hope it's enough.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: cat loves this
customer_reviews.text: my cat loves this. He is food crazed and this is a really great way for him to stay busy it takes him awhile to get them out so its nice. We put food in it which is small so it does not work as intended - the small bits just run right down into the lower part. Might be nice to have the option to control the size of the treats placed in the upper bowl. But best purchase we have made for him.
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Paws too big for this
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I continue to spend money on my cat. He usually doesn't like anything that I buy him and this was no exception. He did engage it several times as long as the treats were in the two center areas. His paws were too big for the fish bowls and he was not interested in trying to get treats out of the boxes. He will give this some attention but it is wuickly lost after about 5 minutes. He's a cat, that's what they do and it's our job to deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save the box
customer_reviews.text: This was interesting to my cats for about a week. All the brou-ha-ha about cognitive development and averting boredom, etc. etc. phooey. They like a good old cardboard box best. Save your money. Plus it is a pain to clean.
customer_reviews.author: carpoozie22

customer_reviews.title: Excellent activity for lazy hungry cats!
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES this product! Best for cats who are obsessed with food. With proper motivation they can solve all the puzzles. I started with the easiest, showing him with dry food and my fingers how it works. The bowls were the hardest but I left dry food in them and eventually he figured it out. I came home one day and they were empty! Good at keeping them busy and slows down fast eaters.
customer_reviews.author: thaisurfer

customer_reviews.title: Great concept IF you can get your cat interested in it and if it was bigger.
customer_reviews.text: It's okay - it would be even better if my cats took even a smidge of interest in it. I showed it to them and put treats in it and the treats have sat there for 3 days now. My husband tried playing with it with them and nada. The holes are too small and we don't have big cats. They just can't get their paws in to get the treats. This might be okay for kittens if you can get them interested in it, but it's not been fun for us and the fact that it's small and you can get it only in white is disappointing too.
customer_reviews.author: Chelle

customer_reviews.title: Great for Over Weight Kitties
customer_reviews.text: One my kitty-babies was over weight from free feeding kibble. It was recommended by my vet to take up the crunchy food but I didn't want to do that. My oldest girl has been free fed her entire life; instead, I searched for an economical way to keep the free feeding. This encourages the kitties to work for their food and discourages over eating. Good, sturdy little center worth the purchase. Tip: to get my kitties interested in this I placed some of their favorite treats inside to encourage them. I also used one finger to "play" with the treats while they were watching in order to teach them how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for my cat.
customer_reviews.text: This product is expensive, took a while to arrive and at first my cat played with it (no more than three minutes) after that.... Never again. It is well build, love the concept but my cat doesn't even bother. Despite all the treat I leave, she doesn't touch them. Makes me upset bc it was expensive and I was looking forward to seeing her play during night but nothing. So be careful, great concept but your cat may not care for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They love it!
customer_reviews.text: This one is definitely easier than the Poker Box. Well, except for the fish bowls. Those were the hardest for them to figure out. They mastered it quickly, but still seem to enjoy playing with it. Seems to keep them entertained. I've run this through the dishwasher multiple times (top shelf), and it's held up perfectly. (I unscrewed the globes & hung them over the tines)
customer_reviews.author: L. Sulik

customer_reviews.title: Good for multiple cats!
customer_reviews.text: We have three cats and all three of them love this thing. We’ve had problems with our cats eating too fast and then throwing up; this activity board hasn’t stopped that completely but it definitely helps. They all were interested in it immediately and two of them often use it at the same time with no issues. It’s a bit of a struggle to take apart and clean (I have arthritis though so probably not difficult for the average person) and doesn’t hold a lot of food for 3 cats. Those are my only downsides. I would gladly purchase this again!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: My cat didn't approve
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea of this.....sadly my cat wasn't interested. But then I thought, "Hey, the squirrels out back will love this!!!" I hid nuts inside the compartments thinking those clever squirrels will learn how to get them out quickly, and it will be entertaining to watch.....sadly they just chewed through the plastic to get the nuts. I had to throw the thing out.
customer_reviews.author: Maginnis

customer_reviews.title: To be honest she seemed pretty annoyed. We used this product for a couple ...
customer_reviews.text: It didn't work at all for slowing down kitty eating and it didn't keep her occupied. To be honest she seemed pretty annoyed. We used this product for a couple of weeks and now it is out in the barn. She couldn't get the food out of the glass bowls. And I let her empty the thing completely just to see if I could get her to try. Some cats may love it but mine didn't. It does seem like it is a well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

product_meta.title: Trixie Activity
product_meta.description: Color:Tunnel FeederCats are frisky and inquisitive animals. Channel their energy and curiosity into something positive with Trixie's Tunnel Feeder for Cats. Simply fill the center container with your pet's favorite small treats or dry food, replace the lid and let the games begin. Their rewards tumble down into six different tunnels where your feline can poke, scoop, jab and nibble away. You can also adjust the level of output to regulate how quickly treats/food are released, so it can also be used as a daily feeder. We've also included an instructional booklet with tips and tricks to stimulate your cat's sense of curiosity through play. Dishwasher safe. One year warranty. Measures 11 x 6 Inch.
feature_bullets: Simply fill with small, hard treats and watch your cat play
Treats released into 6 tunnels as cat pokes, scoops and jabs
Adjustable level of output to vary how quickly treats are released
Can also be used as a daily feeder
Simply fill with small, hard treats and watch your cat play
Adjustable level of output to vary how quickly treats are released
Can also be used as a daily feeder

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
